issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

This message was automatically generated.
I think a RW lock is a little heavy here.  [~kasha] has some factoid about how a RW lock is actually slower than normal synchronization in low-demand scenarios.  Can we just synchronize on an Object?

Thanks [~templedf] for the review.
You are correct. Javadoc of ReentrantReadWriteLock suggests the same as well. 

Will change to synchronizing on an object.

TestRMRestart test failure to be tracked by YARN-5548

Thanks [~varun_saxena] for the patch,
Yes the access to {{RMContextImpl.getHAServiceState()}} though done in multiple places, it seems to be not as critical flows like Heartbeat, so though initially offline i suggested to use RW locks, simple locking looks fine.
Overall patch LGTM, +1

Is this issue fixed and reopened for any purpose? I see corresponding commit with this JIRA description and got reverted.

Hi [~rohithsharma], 
Sorry my bad, i had wrongly committed changes of YARN-5572, with this jira id and title, hence had to revert and recommit.
Is there are any other better way to handle it (like modify only the commit message using ??"git commit --amend"??) without much impact ? As i was not sure I did revert.

Any way this jira is also ready to be committed (thats where the confusion started :( ) , will commit it by end of today !
oh.. that's fine. I am not sure about impact of using --amend. May be some kind of documentation for committers like FAQ would be good in wiki.
